Context:
The George Brown College School of Work and College Preparation offers various programs for unique needs, including:
1. Pre-programs in business, community services, and health sciences for qualification for further study and career exploration.
2. College Vocational program providing vocational assessment, upgrading in communications, math, and computers; life skills, career planning, and work experience placement for students with mild- to- moderate intellectual disabilities.
3. Transitions to Post-Secondary Education focusing on academic skills, vocational preparation, and personal development.
4. Augmented Education, a partnership with the Centre for Mental Health and Addiction (CAMH), offering entry-level job training as an Assistant Cook or Construction Craft Worker.
5. Academic Upgrading programs to improve skills for college or work in communications, Math, computers, and Science.
6. Deaf and hard-of-hearing Adults program preparing students for further education or work.
